title: Envisioning the future of computing
summary: MIT students participated in the Envisioning the Future of Computing Prize, an essay contest that encouraged them to imagine how advances in computing could improve society. The students proposed innovative ideas, such as using digital twins to navigate online information and creating personalized storytelling films using AI and biosensors. The winning entry explored the implications of a personalized language model that predicts an individual's writing based on their past texts and emails. Other finalists discussed using reinforcement learning with human feedback to transform interactions with AI and developing automatic fact checkers to combat misinformation. The contest aimed to promote creative and informed thinking about the societal impact of technology.
